designers.name: Stéphanie Sivrière
education: École de la Chambre Syndicale de la Bijouterie

designers.name: Norbert Stumpfl
designers.biography: Norbert Stumpfl is an Austrian fashion designer who has been serving as the Design Director of Brioni since 2018. He has been instrumental in modernizing Brioni's tailoring aesthetic while maintaining its luxury heritage. Before Brioni, he worked at Louis Vuitton, Lanvin, and Berluti, where he developed his expertise in luxury menswear and tailoring.
education: Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design

designers.name: Brendan Mullane
designers.biography: Brendan Mullane served as Creative Director at Brioni from 2012 to 2016. During his tenure, he modernized the brand's formal wear and introduced ready-to-wear collections. Prior to Brioni, he held positions at Givenchy, Hermès, Louis Vuitton, and Burberry, where he developed a strong understanding of luxury menswear and accessories.
awards: British Fashion Council Menswear Designer of the Year Nominee 2015
education: Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design

designers.name: Peter Hawkings
designers.biography: Peter Hawkings was appointed Creative Director of Tom Ford in 2025 following the brand's acquisition by Estée Lauder. Having worked alongside Tom Ford for over 25 years, he previously served as Senior Vice President of Menswear at the brand and was instrumental in shaping its aesthetic. His expertise spans both menswear and womenswear, with a particular focus on luxury ready-to-wear and accessories.
education: Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design

designers.name: Casey Cadwallader
designers.biography: Casey Cadwallader is an American fashion designer who served as Creative Director of Mugler from 2018 to 2025. During his tenure, he successfully modernized the brand's signature silhouettes while respecting its heritage of body-conscious designs. Known for his architectural approach to fashion, influenced by his background in architecture, Cadwallader brought a fresh perspective to Mugler through innovative digital presentations and celebrity collaborations.
awards: CFDA Fashion Awards Nominee - International Designer of the Year 2023

designers.name: Zoe Baird
designers.biography: Zoe Baird is a British accessories designer who serves as Co-Creative Director at Delvaux since 2022. Known for her innovative approach to leather goods, she has been instrumental in revitalizing the brand's iconic designs while maintaining its heritage of exceptional craftsmanship.
education: Central Saint Martins - BA Fashion Accessories Design
Royal College of Art - MA Fashion Accessories

designers.name: Marco Probst
designers.biography: Marco Probst is a Swiss accessories designer who joined Delvaux as Co-Creative Director in 2022. With a background in luxury leather goods, he brings technical expertise and contemporary vision to the historic Belgian house.
education: École cantonale d'art de Lausanne - BA Product Design
IED Milano - MA Fashion Accessories Design

designers.name: Christina Zeller
designers.biography: Christina Zeller served as Artistic Director at Delvaux from 2011 to 2020, where she played a crucial role in modernizing the brand while preserving its heritage. During her tenure, she expanded the brand's international presence and created iconic designs like the Cool Box bag line.
education: Institut Français de la Mode - Luxury Brand Management

designers.name: Mark Weston
designers.biography: Mark Weston has been Creative Director of Dunhill since 2017. His tenure has been marked by a successful redefinition of British luxury menswear, blending the house's heritage with contemporary design. Prior to Dunhill, he worked at Burberry under Christopher Bailey.
education: Central Saint Martins - BA Fashion Design
Royal College of Art - MA Fashion Design

designers.name: John Ray
designers.biography: John Ray served as Creative Director of Dunhill from 2013 to 2016. During his tenure, he emphasized British tailoring traditions while modernizing the brand through luxury sportswear and innovative campaigns. Before Dunhill, he was Senior Creative Director at Gucci Menswear.
education: Glasgow School of Art - Fashion Design

designers.name: Steven Quin
designers.biography: Steven Quin served as Creative Director at Thomas Pink during 2020-2021, during a critical period of the brand's transition back to Mullen family ownership from LVMH. His expertise in British shirtmaking and luxury menswear helped maintain the brand's heritage during this pivotal time.
education: London College of Fashion - Fashion Design

designers.name: Robert Emmett
designers.biography: Robert Emmett has been serving as Design Consultant at Thomas Pink since 2021, following the brand's return to Mullen family ownership. With over three decades of experience in luxury shirtmaking, he brings traditional craftsmanship and contemporary vision to the historic British brand.
education: Manchester School of Art - Textile Design

designers.name: Michelle Roth
designers.currentRole: Creative Director at Michelle Roth Bridal
designers.biography: Michelle Roth served as Design Director of Bridal at Vera Wang from 2008 to 2017, where she contributed to the brand's innovative bridal collections. Her work helped define modern bridal fashion through a combination of traditional craftsmanship and contemporary design elements.
education: Parsons School of Design - BFA Fashion Design

designers.name: Sarah Burton
designers.currentRole: Creative Director at Sarah Burton Studio
designers.biography: Sarah Burton served as Design Director of Ready-to-Wear at Vera Wang from 2012 to 2020, where she played a crucial role in developing the brand's contemporary ready-to-wear collections. Her work combined Vera Wang's signature romantic aesthetics with modern sensibilities, contributing to the brand's expansion in the ready-to-wear market.
education: Central Saint Martins - BA Fashion Design

designers.name: Vera Wang
designers.currentRole: Founder and Creative Director at Vera Wang
designers.biography: Vera Ellen Wang is an American fashion designer known for her iconic wedding gowns and ready-to-wear collections. Before launching her own brand in 1990, she was a senior fashion editor at Vogue for 17 years and then a design director at Ralph Lauren. Her designs are known for their elegant sophistication and modern approach to bridal fashion.
awards: CFDA Womenswear Designer of the Year (2005)
Council of Fashion Designers of America Board of Directors Member
André Leon Talley Lifetime Achievement Award (2017)

designers.name: Ralph Lauren
designers.currentRole: Executive Chairman and Chief Creative Officer at Ralph Lauren Corporation
designers.biography: Ralph Lauren is an American fashion designer, philanthropist, and business executive who founded the Ralph Lauren Corporation. Starting with a collection of ties in 1967, Lauren built one of fashion's most successful and recognizable global lifestyle brands. His aspirational yet accessible aesthetic has redefined American style, pioneering the concept of lifestyle branding.
awards: Honorary Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire (2018)
achievements: Official outfitter of the U.S. Olympic Team
Created the Pink Pony Fund for cancer care

brands.name: Celine
brands.notes: The accent was dropped from the brand name (from Céline to Celine) when Hedi Slimane became creative director in 2018.

brands.name: Marc Jacobs
brands.notes: Marc Jacobs was creative director at Louis Vuitton from 1997 to 2014 while simultaneously running his own label.

brands.name: Balenciaga
brands.notes: Cristóbal Balenciaga closed the house in 1968. It was reopened in 1986 under new ownership and has had several creative directors since.

brands.name: Gucci
brands.notes: Family-run until the 1990s. A major revitalization occurred under Tom Ford (1994-2004) and Alessandro Michele (2015-2022).

brands.name: Saint Laurent
brands.notes: Previously known as Yves Saint Laurent (YSL) until 2012 when rebranded under Hedi Slimane's creative direction.

brands.name: Bottega Veneta
brands.notes: Known for its signature 'intrecciato' woven leather technique. Experienced a revival under creative director Daniel Lee (2018-2021).

brands.name: Chloé
brands.notes: Has had several notable creative directors including Karl Lagerfeld, Stella McCartney, Phoebe Philo, and Clare Waight Keller.

brands.name: Alaïa
brands.notes: Following Azzedine Alaïa's death in 2017, Pieter Mulier became creative director in 2021.

brands.name: Delvaux
brands.notes: Considered the oldest fine leather luxury goods house in the world. Acquired by Richemont in 2021.

brands.name: Dunhill
brands.notes: Originally focused on motoring accessories before expanding into luxury menswear and lifestyle products.

brands.name: Cartier
brands.notes: Known for iconic designs like the Love bracelet, Tank watch, and Trinity ring. Jeweler to royal families around the world.

brands.name: Van Cleef & Arpels
brands.founder: Alfred Van Cleef and Salomon Arpels
brands.notes: Known for the Mystery Setting technique, Zip necklace, and Alhambra collection.

brands.name: Montblanc
brands.founder: Claus-Johannes Voss, Alfred Nehemias, and August Eberstein
brands.notes: Originally focused on luxury writing instruments before expanding into watches, leather goods, and accessories.

brands.name: Piaget
brands.notes: Began as a watchmaker before expanding into jewelry. Known for ultra-thin watch movements and luxury jewelry.

brands.name: Prada
brands.notes: Miuccia Prada, granddaughter of founder Mario Prada, transformed the company into a global fashion powerhouse starting in the 1970s.

brands.name: Miu Miu
brands.notes: Named after Miuccia Prada's family nickname. Functions as a more youthful, experimental sister brand to Prada.

brands.name: Church's
brands.notes: Historic British footwear brand known for Goodyear-welted shoes. Acquired by Prada Group in 1999.

brands.name: Car Shoe
brands.notes: Known for driving moccasins with rubber-studded soles. Acquired by Prada Group in 2001.

brands.name: Diesel
brands.notes: Known for innovative denim treatments and edgy marketing campaigns. Glenn Martens became creative director in 2020.

brands.name: Maison Margiela
brands.notes: Originally named Maison Martin Margiela until 2014 when rebranded after Martin Margiela's departure. John Galliano became creative director in 2014.

brands.name: Marni
brands.notes: Known for experimental prints and colors. Francesco Risso became creative director in 2016 after founder Consuelo Castiglioni's departure.

brands.name: Jil Sander
brands.notes: Known for minimalist aesthetic. Jil Sander herself left the company in 2000, returned in 2003, then left again in 2004. Lucie and Luke Meier have been creative directors since 2017.

brands.name: Coach
brands.notes: Began as a family-run leather goods workshop. Stuart Vevers became creative director in 2013, repositioning the brand upmarket.

brands.name: Kate Spade
brands.notes: Kate Spade left the company in 2007, and tragically passed away in 2018. Known for colorful, playful designs with a modern sensibility.

brands.name: Stuart Weitzman
brands.notes: Stuart Weitzman sold the company to Tapestry (then Coach) in 2015 and stepped down as creative director in 2017.

brands.name: Valentino
brands.notes: Valentino Garavani retired in 2008. Pierpaolo Piccioli became sole creative director in 2016 after Maria Grazia Chiuri's departure to Dior.

brands.name: Balmain
brands.notes: Olivier Rousteing became creative director in 2011, significantly transforming the brand's aesthetic and digital presence.

brands.name: Versace
brands.notes: After Gianni Versace's murder in 1997, his sister Donatella Versace became creative director. The company was acquired by Capri Holdings (formerly Michael Kors Holdings) in 2018.

brands.name: Jimmy Choo
brands.notes: Jimmy Choo sold his share in the company in 2001. The brand was acquired by Capri Holdings in 2017.

brands.name: Michael Kors
brands.notes: Michael Kors Holdings Limited rebranded as Capri Holdings in 2018 following the acquisition of Versace.

brands.name: Jean Paul Gaultier
brands.notes: Jean Paul Gaultier retired from ready-to-wear in 2014 and from haute couture in 2020, with the brand continuing through rotating guest designers.

brands.name: Nina Ricci
brands.notes: Founded by Maria Ricci and her son Robert. Harris Reed became creative director in 2023.

brands.name: Carolina Herrera
brands.notes: Carolina Herrera stepped down as creative director in 2018, appointing Wes Gordon as her successor while remaining as a brand ambassador.

brands.name: Dries Van Noten
brands.notes: Part of the influential 'Antwerp Six' group of designers. Majority stake acquired by Puig in 2018, with Dries Van Noten remaining as creative director.

brands.name: Chanel
brands.notes: Following Coco Chanel's death in 1971, Karl Lagerfeld served as creative director from 1983 until his death in 2019, when Virginie Viard took over.

brands.name: Hermès
brands.notes: Remains largely family-controlled with a focus on traditional craftsmanship. Famous for iconic products like the Birkin and Kelly bags.

brands.name: The Row
brands.notes: Named after London's Savile Row. Known for minimalist aesthetic and exceptional quality.

brands.name: Rick Owens
brands.notes: Known for avant-garde, gothic aesthetic. Expanded into furniture design in 2007.

brands.name: Marine Serre
brands.notes: Won the LVMH Prize in 2017. Known for sustainable practices and futuristic sportswear featuring crescent moon motif.

brands.name: Wales Bonner
brands.notes: Won the LVMH Prize in 2016. Known for exploring cultural identity and black male identity through fashion.

brands.name: Simone Rocha
brands.notes: Daughter of designer John Rocha. Known for combining traditionally feminine elements with a modern edge.

brands.name: Jacquemus
brands.notes: Known for dramatic silhouettes, bold colors, and mini handbags. Has built significant social media presence.

brands.name: Ganni
brands.notes: L Catterton acquired majority stake in 2017. Known for Scandinavian aesthetic with playful elements.

brands.name: Peter Do
brands.notes: Peter Do previously worked at Céline under Phoebe Philo. Named creative director of Helmut Lang in 2023.

brands.name: Lemaire
brands.notes: Co-designed by Christophe Lemaire and Sarah-Linh Tran since 2010. Christophe Lemaire previously worked as creative director at Hermès (2010-2014).

brands.name: Bode
brands.notes: Known for using antique textiles and traditional craft techniques. First female designer to show at New York Fashion Week: Men's.

brands.name: Alexander McQueen
brands.notes: Following Alexander McQueen's death in 2010, Sarah Burton served as creative director until 2023. Seán McGirr was appointed creative director in October 2023.

brands.name: Lanvin
brands.notes: Oldest French fashion house still in operation. Acquired by Fosun International (now Lanvin Group) in 2018. Bruno Sialelli is the current creative director since 2019.

brands.name: Ferragamo
brands.notes: Rebranded from Salvatore Ferragamo to simply Ferragamo in 2023. Maximilian Davis became creative director in 2022.

brands.name: Moschino
brands.notes: Known for irreverent, playful designs. Following Franco Moschino's death in 1994, Jeremy Scott served as creative director from 2013 to 2023. Adrian Appiolaza became creative director in 2023.

brands.name: Comme des Garçons
brands.notes: Known for avant-garde, conceptual designs that challenge conventional notions of beauty and fashion. Rei Kawakubo continues to lead the company.

brands.name: Issey Miyake
brands.notes: Known for technological innovation in fabric and pleating techniques. Following Issey Miyake's death in 2022, Satoshi Kondo continues as design director for the main line.

brands.name: A Bathing Ape
brands.notes: Nigo left the brand in 2013 after it was acquired by I.T Group in 2011. Now creative director at Kenzo.

brands.name: Number Nine
brands.notes: The brand was active from 1997 to 2009, when Takahiro Miyashita left to start TAKAHIROMIYASHITATheSoloist.

brands.name: The Soloist
brands.notes: Founded by Takahiro Miyashita after leaving Number Nine. Known for avant-garde designs with rock and punk influences.

brands.name: Y/Project
brands.notes: After founder Yohan Serfaty's death in 2013, Glenn Martens took over as creative director, transforming the brand into a critically acclaimed label known for experimental designs.

brands.name: Dolce & Gabbana
brands.notes: Known for Mediterranean-inspired designs and Sicilian motifs. The founders continue to lead the company as co-creative directors.

brands.name: Mugler
brands.notes: Following Thierry Mugler's retirement in 2002 and death in 2022, the brand has been led by several creative directors. Since 2023, the house is led by American designer Casey Cadwallader.

brands.name: Vetements
brands.notes: Demna Gvasalia left the brand in 2019, with his brother Guram Gvasalia taking over as creative director while continuing as CEO.

brands.name: Helmut Lang
brands.notes: Helmut Lang left the brand in 2005. After several creative directors, Peter Do was appointed in 2023.

brands.name: Ann Demeulemeester
brands.notes: Part of the 'Antwerp Six' group of designers. Ann Demeulemeester left the brand in 2013. Acquired by Claes Iversen in 2020.

brands.name: Vivienne Westwood
brands.notes: Known for punk-inspired designs and environmental activism. Following Vivienne Westwood's death in 2022, her husband Andreas Kronthaler continues as creative director.

brands.name: Walter Van Beirendonck
brands.notes: Part of the 'Antwerp Six' group of designers. Known for colorful, avant-garde designs with political and social commentary.

brands.name: Dior Homme
brands.notes: Men's division of Christian Dior. Established under Hedi Slimane (2000-2007), followed by Kris Van Assche (2007-2018), and currently led by Kim Jones since 2018.

brands.name: Dior
brands.notes: Founded by Christian Dior in 1946. Maria Grazia Chiuri became the first female creative director of Dior womenswear in 2016.

brands.name: Christian Dior
brands.notes: One of the primary houses within LVMH. This entry refers to the main Christian Dior brand entity.

brands.name: Calvin Klein
brands.notes: Calvin Klein sold his company to PVH Corp (then Phillips-Van Heusen) in 2002. Raf Simons was creative director from 2016 to 2018. Currently operates with a design collective approach.

brands.name: Maison Martin Margiela
brands.notes: Original name of the brand before being rebranded to Maison Margiela in 2014 after Martin Margiela's departure. This entry is maintained for historical reference.

brands.name: Yohji Yamamoto
brands.notes: Known for avant-garde designs and primarily black collections. Influential in the Japanese design movement of the 1980s.

brands.name: Supreme
brands.notes: Originally a skateboarding shop that evolved into a global streetwear brand. Acquired by VF Corporation in 2020. Luke Meier worked at Supreme but was not the founder.

brands.name: OAMC
brands.notes: Name stands for Over All Master Cloth. Founded by Luke Meier (former head designer at Supreme) and Arnaud Faeh.

brands.name: TAKAHIROMIYASHITA TheSoloist.
brands.notes: Full brand name of The Soloist. Founded by Takahiro Miyashita after leaving Number Nine.

brands.name: Tom Ford
brands.notes: Founded after Tom Ford left his position as creative director at Gucci and Yves Saint Laurent. Acquired by Estée Lauder Companies in 2022.

brands.name: Christian Lacroix
brands.notes: Filed for bankruptcy in 2009 and restructured as a licensing operation. No longer produces haute couture or ready-to-wear collections under Lacroix's direction.

brands.name: Thomas Pink
brands.notes: British shirtmaker known for high-quality dress shirts. Sold to LVMH in 1999, but bought back by the Mullen family in 2021.

brands.name: Vera Wang
brands.notes: Known for bridal wear designs. Expanded into ready-to-wear, accessories, and lifestyle products through licensing agreements.

brands.name: Ralph Lauren
brands.notes: Started as a tie company before expanding into a global lifestyle brand. Includes sub-brands like Polo Ralph Lauren, Purple Label, and RRL.

brands.name: Lacoste
brands.notes: Founded by tennis player René Lacoste. Known for polo shirts with the iconic crocodile logo. Has collaborated with luxury designers including Maison Margiela and Thom Browne.

brands.name: Uniqlo
brands.notes: Known for affordable basics and technical fabrics. Has collaborated with luxury designers including Jil Sander (J+), Christophe Lemaire, and Marni.

brands.name: Adidas
brands.notes: Sportswear brand that has collaborated with luxury designers including Yohji Yamamoto (Y-3), Stella McCartney, Prada, and Balenciaga.

brands.name: Miyake Design Studio
brands.notes: Design studio founded by Issey Miyake in 1970 to support innovation and product development across Issey Miyake collections. Functions as an innovation hub rather than a consumer-facing brand.

brands.name: Ann Demeulemeester Serax
brands.notes: Homeware and tableware collaboration line between Ann Demeulemeester and Serax, launched in 2020 under Ann Demeulemeester's artistic direction, separate from the main fashion label.

brands.name: SEX
brands.notes: Historical retail location and cultural incubator founded by Vivienne Westwood and Malcolm McLaren in 1974, pivotal to the punk movement; not a traditional fashion brand. The shop was previously called 'Let It Rock' and later became 'Seditionaries'.

brands.name: Walter Van Beirendonck
brands.notes: Eponymous designer label launched by Walter Van Beirendonck in 1983; part of the Antwerp Six movement.

brands.name: Royal Academy of Fine Arts Antwerp
brands.notes: Historic educational institution founded in 1663, known for its Fine Arts and Fashion departments. Produced influential designers such as the Antwerp Six. Not a commercial brand.

tenures.impactDescription: Revolutionized fashion with avant-garde designs and iconic collections
Bringing fresh perspective while honoring house codes
Introducing gender-fluid aesthetics to the historic house

notableCollections: Spring 2018 - Final Collection as Creative Director
tenures.impactDescription: Established a legacy of elegant American fashion
Modernizing the house while maintaining its elegant DNA
Creating unique artistic vision through prints and textiles

achievements: Maintained Chanel's legacy while bringing a more understated approach
Established Hermès as a harness workshop serving European noblemen
Transformed Hermès into a global luxury brand
Maintained family tradition while expanding the brand's artistic vision
CFDA Womenswear Designer of the Year (multiple times)
CFDA Womenswear Designer of the Year (multiple times)
British Designer of the Year Womenswear 2016
Staged iconic runway shows in lavender fields and wheat fields
tenures.impactDescription: Created a distinctive aesthetic that blends French heritage with modern sensibilities

achievements: Transformed Ganni into a global fashion phenomenon
tenures.impactDescription: Redefined Scandinavian style with a playful, colorful aesthetic
Grew Ganni from a small Danish brand to a global contemporary fashion label
Established Ganni as a cashmere brand in Denmark

achievements: Built Diesel into a global denim brand
tenures.impactDescription: Revolutionized the denim industry with innovative designs and marketing

achievements: Created iconic designs like Tabi boots
tenures.impactDescription: Fundamentally challenged fashion conventions with conceptual designs

achievements: Revitalized the brand while respecting its heritage
tenures.impactDescription: Brought a new theatrical perspective while honoring Margiela's conceptual approach

achievements: Built Marni into a respected luxury brand
tenures.impactDescription: Created a unique aesthetic that appealed to intellectual fashion consumers

achievements: Brought a youthful energy to Marni
tenures.impactDescription: Maintained Marni's artistic spirit while bringing a fresh perspective
Defined modern minimalism in fashion
Brief return to her eponymous brand
Second return to her eponymous brand

achievements: Revitalized the brand's minimalist aesthetic for a new generation
tenures.impactDescription: Brought a modern sensibility to Jil Sander's minimalist legacy

achievements: Revitalized the brand's minimalist aesthetic for a new generation
tenures.impactDescription: Brought a modern sensibility to Jil Sander's minimalist legacy
